isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1997) - SECTION 3.5: CIRCUIT FUNCTION AND DIAGNOSTICS - ENGINE CRANK INHIBIT SYSTEM (ECI) - ELECTRONIC CONTROL MODULE (ECM)

svcproc.title: ELECTRONIC CONTROL MODULE (ECM)
svcproc.para: With the key ON, the ECM enables the crank relay if the engine is not running and if 12 volts is present at terminal 10 with an automatic transmission.
With a manual transmission, the ECM programming doesn't look at terminal 10 in enabling the crank inhibit relay.
To enable the crank inhibit relay, the ECM sets terminal 35 LOW (ground state). To disable the crank relay, terminal 35 is HIGH (12 volts).
